description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no. 2 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference 185616VAR dated  11/10/2019 for "Application for a Minor Material Amendment (s73) to vary Condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission ref. 178784FUL dated 07.12.2018 for the 'Redevelopment of the site to provide 131 flats (89 x one bed, 39 x two bed and 3 x three bed units) and 479sqm commercial floor space accommodated within a part seven to nine storey residential building fronting onto the High Street with ground floor commercial use (retail, and/or financial/professional services, and/or restaurant/café - flexible A1, A2 and A3 use classes)(Block A); and an adjoining part three to five storey residential building fronting onto Shrubbery Road (Block B); together with associated pedestrian through-access, disabled car parking, cycle storage, private and communal amenity spaces, refuse and recycling storage, and hard and soft landscaping'. Variation seeks an increase in the number of units (from 131 to 139) which would involve extensions to Block A at the 7th and 8th floor levels, and extensions to Block B at the 6th and 7th floor levels". Variation seeks to allow a variation to the drawings to bring forward a conversion of the approved management office and management storage units to two studio flats, drawing numbers to be varied accordingly to refence the submitted drawing numbers.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall have begun before the expiration of three years from the 17th December 2018.

Reason: In order to ensure that this allocated site is brought forward for development as soon as practicable and to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 404 B (10) P00 (Location Plan); 404 B (20) E00 (Existing Elevations); 0000 Rev 7 (Site Plan); 0102 Rev 10 (Second Floor Plan); 0103 Rev 11 (Third Floor Plan); 0104 Rev 11 (Fourth Floor Plan); 0105 Rev 11 (Fifth Floor Plan); 0106 Rev 11 (Sixth Floor Plan); 0107 Rev 11 (Seventh Floor Plan); 0108 Rev 11 (Eight Floor Plan); 0200 Rev 3 (South Elevation); 0201 Rev 3 (East Elevation); 0203 Rev 3 (West Elevation); 0205 Rev 3 (North Elevation) as amended by drawing Nos. 0108 Rev. 14 (Eighth Floor Plan); 106 Rev. 13 (Sixth Floor Plan); 0107 Rev. 16 (Seventh Floor Plan); 0109 Rev. 03 (Roof Plan); 0100 Rev. 02 (Ground Floor Plan Waste Disposal); 0204 Rev. 04 (North Elevation); 0201 Rev. 03 (South Elevation) (all received: 14.03.2019); 0203 Rev. 01 (West Elevation) (received 04.12.2018); 0201 Rev. 04 (East Elevation); 404B-CDA-XX-ZZ-DR-10-A-0100, 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-20-A-0114, 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-A-20-0114-Rev 01 received 6.06.2023 (Proposed Ground Floor), 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-A-20-0116- Rev 01 (First Floor Plan), 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-A-20-0115- Rev 01 (North Elevation), 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-A-20-0118- Rev 01 (Existing Ground Floor), 404B-CDA-B-ZZ-DR-A-20-0117- Rev 01 (Existing North Elevation), Internal Daylight and Sunlight Report by Waldrams (November 2022).

Planning Statement by CgMS (December 2017); Design and Access Statement - C by Create (November 2017); Affordable Housing Statement by CgMS (December 2017); Framework Delivery and Servicing Management Plan by Motion ( 01/12/2017); Framework Residential Travel Plan by Motion ( 01/12/2017); Transport Statement by Motion ( 01/12/2017); Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (25/11/2017) prepared by DK Partnership; Flood Risk and SUDS Statement, Drainage Assessment Form and Appendices by Don Bennett Consulting ( December 2016) and SUDS Addendum ref. P17-102 49 High Street, Technical Note (November 2017) prepared by Rodgers Leask; Updated Proposal Scheme for the Former 'White Hart Public House', Southall, Archaeological Assessment (undated and author unknown); Geo-Environmental Desk Study / Preliminary Risk Assessment Report by Jomas Associates Limited (November 2017); Daylight and Sunlight Assessment of Surrounding Dwellings, ref. A2809/DS/003 by Accon UK ( 05/07/2017) and Technical Note by Accon UK (16/06/2017) and Sunlight and Daylight Statement by Point 2 Surveyors ( November 2017); Ecological Assessment by Ecology Solutions (December 2017); as amended by Design and Access Statement Rev D by Create Design and Architecture (November 2018); Daylight and Sunlight Statement by Point 2 Surveyors Ltd (April 2019); as amended by Affordable Housing Statement on behalf of Home Group by GL Hearn (September 2020); and as amended by Planning Statement on behalf of Home Group by GL Hearn ( 23rd September 2020), Internal Daylight and Sunlight Report by Waldrams (November 2022).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Construction Method Statement and Management Plan approved under ref. 178930CND dated 03/09/2020. Any areas used for the storage of building materials or other site activities outside of the relevant phase of the development shall be returned to the original condition immediately following the practical completion of the development.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies SI1, T4, T6 and D14  of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The development hereby shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the detailed surface water drainage design (including relevant specifications) and maintenance plan approved under ref. 190695CND dated 03/09/2020.

Reason:  To reduce flood risk in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework and policies SI12 and SI13 of the London Plan. | The materials used for the external surfaces of the development shall be Traditional Buff Brick : Kemsley Yellow - Wienerberger; Staffordshire slate blue brick smooth; aged copper curtain walls, with aluminium feature caps/mullions coated with Interpon D1036 SL843G RAL 7043 Matt HR; obscure glazed balustrades with aluminium capping powder coated with Interpon D1036 SL843G RAL 7043 Matt HR; and fibre cement boards coated with D1036 SA810G RAL 7040 Matt HR internal to balconies. These materials shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be carried out strictly in accordance with recommendations by Accon UK in their report ref. A3214/N/001 dated 16.11.2017 (and sound insulation including frames, seals and ventilators laboratory tested and approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 140-3: 1995 & BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and the details approved under ref. 190792CND dated 22/06/2020. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to commencement of the superstructure works, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely living rooms/ kitchen adjacent/ above/ below bedroom of separate dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the superstructure works, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating plant rooms/ lifts/ communal facilities from [dwellings] [noise sensitive premises]. Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w ] is enhanced by at least 10dB above the Building Regulations value and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures implemented to separate communal noise and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings/ noise sensitive premises. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to commencement of the superstructure works, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from [dwellings] [noise sensitive premises]. Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w ] is enhanced by at least 10-15dB above the Building Regulations value and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings/ noise sensitive premises. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The details and mitigation measures approved under ref. 190705CND dated 30/10/2020 shall be implemented prior to first use of plant/machinery/equipment and thereafter be permanently retained to prevent any adverse impact from plant and machinery on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The commercial use shall not commence until all external doors to the commercial premises have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to commercial premises be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The development shall be strictly carried out in accordance with ventilation details approved under ref. 190707CND dated 22/06/2020. The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to first occupation and shall be maintained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The development shall be strictly carried out in accordance with the landscaping details approved under ref. 213734CND dated 25/02/2022. The hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment as approved shall be completed prior to first occupation and shall be maintained permanently thereafter.

The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code Of Practice For General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision. All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions. Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and amenity of prospective occupiers, and and ensure appropriate tree planting in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to occupation, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development complies with the Air Quality Neutral Building Emissions Benchmark for the proposed residential use as stated in Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan.

Reason: To ensure that the building emissions from the development does not contribute to poor air quality to the detriment of future occupiers, neighbouring occupiers and general public health, in accordance with policies SI1 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and the GLA Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Prior to the commencement of the development, including both domestic and nondomestic components, a sustainability statement, which includes full details of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development to achieve the requirements of the local and regional planning policies shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority in line with the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies SI1, SI2, SI3, SI4, SI5, SI7 and SI13 of the London Plan (2021), policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to commencement of the residential element of the development, a water efficiency statement shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating all measures that will be incorporated to ensure that the residential units will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day. Development shall proceed in accordance with the approved water efficiency statement.

Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy SI5 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the information submitted in support of the application, within 6 months from the commencement of the superstructure works of the development, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling, being applied to a range of dwellings including top, middle and ground floor, and commercial spaces using the guidance and criteria provided in CIBSE TM49 & TM52 and demonstrating how the development performs against and even exceed the overheating criteria, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted and evidence that these measures can be incorporated into the development if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. The development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy SI4 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, and the Ealing Development Management DPD. | a) Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for that component showing clearly the DER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

b) Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

c) Prior to the final completion of all dwellings of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures, be designed to connect to an offsite CHP district heating network and achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 68.1% (equal to 104.76 tonnes CO2/year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (25 November 2017) prepared by DK Partnership:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 22.02 tonnes CO2 equating to 14.3% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

ii.	Connection to an offsite CHP district heating network to serve all dwellings within the development to achieve at least annual carbon emissions of 63.56 tonnes CO2 equating to 48% in regulated emissions savings over Be Lean stage

iii.	Incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 41.6kWp to provide c. 36.67MWh/yr of electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 19.18 tonnes CO2 equating to 28.1% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions reduction over the Be Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

d) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be identified, incorporated and maintained in all dwellings. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | a) Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial spaces, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for that component showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

b) Within three-months of the practical completion of each non-residential unit evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

c) Prior to the final completion of all commercial spaces of the development, the approved spaces shall incorporate measures, be designed to connect to an offsite CHP district heating network and achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 38.4% (equal to 10.32 tonnes CO2/year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement Issue 6.1 (25 November 2017) prepared by DK Partnership:

i.energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 2.89 tonnes CO2 equating to 10.7% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

ii.Connection to an offsite CHP district heating network to serve all commercial spaces within the development to achieve at least annual carbon emissions of 7.43 tonnes CO2 equating to 31% in regulated emissions savings over Be Lean stage

d) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be identified, incorporated and maintained in all commercial spaces. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The development shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the energy centre and heat network details approved under ref. 190730CND dated 16/09/2020 and in accordance with Energy Strategy conditions 12 and 13 and S106 DHN clause. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Travel Plan approved under ref. 200257CND dated 09/10/2020.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies T2 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (f) and 1.1(g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | The cycle parking shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved under ref. 200826CND dated 22/06/2020. The approved details shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Ealing Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG, and The London Cycle Design Standards. | Prior to the first residential use of the development hereby approved, two disabled vehicle parking spaces, at least one of which shall be provided with an active electric car charging point, shall be provided on-site and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of sufficient electric car charging points, and blue badge parking in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.2(k) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and the adopted 'Sustainable Transport for New Development' supplementary planning document. | The passenger lifts located within the communal cores serving the approved apartment block shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the apartment block to which the lift serves.

Reason:  To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy D5 of The London Plan (2021),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Ninety percent of the approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy D7 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Ten percent of the approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(3) (Wheelchair user dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical standards in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason: To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing in a timely fashion that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide an appropriate choice and housing opportunity for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with the objectives of policies D3 and D7 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The refuse and recycling storage provision and collection arrangements shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any dwelling or commercial unit to which the store(s) serves and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Delivery and Servicing Management Plan.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g) and 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Notwithstanding any information submitted, prior to the occupation of the development full details of hard and soft landscaping works (including a phased programme of works), children's play equipment and other furniture, and boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall include detailed specifications of the proposed planting within the proposed public realm. The approved works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied:

a. The first and second floor windows in the east-facing elevation of Block B serving flats 1.01 and 2.01 shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained for the life of the development; and
b. Details shall be submitted of privacy screening for the east-facing elevation of the balconies serving flats 1.01 and 2.01 of Block B shall be submitted to the LPA for approval.
The approved details shall be installed prior to occupation and shall be maintained for the life of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The hours of business use for the ground floor flexible-use commercial units (A1 and/or A2 and/or A3 Use Classes) hereby approved shall be restricted to the period [0700 - 2300hrs] Monday to Sunday.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and the prospective residential occupiers of the development in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the ground floor commercial units shall not be subdivided or amalgamated and shall only be used for A1, and/or A2, and/or A3 Use Class activities, and not for any other use.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use, and to safeguard the vitality and viability of the shopping and town centre in accordance with policies SD6 and SD7 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(d), 2.7(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and policy 4C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the occupation of any commercial units for restaurant or café use (A3 use class), details and specifications of the ventilation duct including noise and vibration mitigation, odour abatement, and its siting and external appearance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation and retained for the duration of the use.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved contaminated land investigation, remediation scheme and verification report approved under ref. 190732CND dated 07/10/2020.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents and ensure that land contamination issues are addressed in accordance policy 5.21 of The Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development of the additional two ground floor studio units, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling structures separating multi use rooms in adjoining dwellings/areas, e.g. kitchen/ living/ dining room adjoining/above/below sleeping accommodation of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the L
